title: Buer (dNetHack)
data:
- *For the [demon lord](/wiki/Demon_lord "Demon lord") in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), see [Buer (SpliceHack)](/index.php?title=Buer_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Buer (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)").*

**Buer, who walks all places** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [5.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [5.2 Strategy](#Strategy_2)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

There are no additional restrictions or requirements to bind Buer.

To remain bound to Buer, a character cannot use death magic, such as the [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death").

## Mark

The legs of a character that has Buer bound bifurcate into four cloven-hooved feet that can be seen from a distance, but can be hidden by wearing [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots").

## Benefits

While bound, Buer grants extra [hit point](/wiki/Hit_point "Hit point") [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), with the character gaining HP equal to roughly 6 times the character's spirit die size every 90 turns. This is affected by a lit [Atma Weapon](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Atma_Weapon "DNetHack artifacts") as normal. Buer also grants [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in [healing spells](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells") and [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts"), and binding Buer once will permanently teach the character martial arts.

Buer's active powers are as follows:

- **Gift of Healing**: Heal yourself or a single adjacent target for 5 dice of HP.
- **Gift of Health**: Clear most status ailments from yourself or a single target. On yourself, cures [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness"), [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") (including from [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie") gunk and the like), [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination"), [nausea](/wiki/Nausea "Nausea"), [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"), [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun"), and [wounded legs](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs"), in addition to the effects of a blessed [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability").

Their passive powers are as follows:

- **Keen Nose**: You gain [food appraisal](/wiki/Food_appraisal "Food appraisal").

## Strategy

Buer's Gift of Healing is perhaps best used to keep a character's [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") alive, since monster healing is far slower at 1 HP per 20 turns.

## As a monster

| z Buer *(No tile)*                                              |                                          |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 18                                       |
| **Attacks**                                                     | bite 8d2 poison (CON), kick 6d4 physical |
|                                                                 |                                          |

| z Buer *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                          |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 18                                       |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | bite 8d2 poison (CON), kick 6d4 physical |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                          |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 16                                       |
| **Base [experience](/wiki/Experience_points "Experience points")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 486                                      |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | 16                                       |
| **Base [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 4                                        |
| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 40                                       |
| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 0 (neutral)                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                          |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | 0 (Not randomly generated)               |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | No                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                          |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | 3000                                     |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | 600                                      |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | large                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                          |
| Buer:* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is either male or female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                          |

In notdNetHack, **Buer**, z, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"). They are a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [zruty-like](/wiki/Zruty_\(monster_class\) "Zruty (monster class)") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is considered both male and female, and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

Buer possesses a bite attack that is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") and drains [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), as well as a kick attack.

Like many summoned spirits, Buer cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Buer is first generated when summoned from their seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. They are always created hostile, and are not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Buer is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") the uncursed **Talisman of Buer**, an artifact [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") that grants regeneration and [sustain ability](/wiki/Sustain_ability "Sustain ability") while worn, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to heal the wearer: it restores an amount of HP equal to half the character's maximum while curing sickness, blindness and [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming"), much like [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius") or [Release from Care](/index.php?title=Release_from_Care\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Release from Care (page does not exist)").

Buer [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

Outside of their poisonous bite and 16 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), Buer is fortunately rather unremarkable for a spirit that an Illithanachronounbinder must bind sooner or later, especially permanently unlock martial arts.

If Buer is killed after being summoned, they can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Buer is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes them [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

Who are you, and where are you going?

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Buer (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the demon lord in SpliceHack, see Buer (SpliceHack).

Buer, who walks all places is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Ritual, seal and taboo
  • 2 Mark
  • 3 Benefits
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 As a monster
    • 5.1 Generation
    • 5.2 Strategy
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry

Ritual, seal and taboo

There are no additional restrictions or requirements to bind Buer.

To remain bound to Buer, a character cannot use death magic, such as the finger of death.

Mark

The legs of a character that has Buer bound bifurcate into four cloven-hooved feet that can be seen from a distance, but can be hidden by wearing boots.

Benefits

While bound, Buer grants extra hit point regeneration, with the character gaining HP equal to roughly 6 times the character's spirit die size every 90 turns. This is affected by a lit Atma Weapon as normal. Buer also grants skill in healing spells and martial arts, and binding Buer once will permanently teach the character martial arts.

Buer's active powers are as follows:

  • Gift of Healing: Heal yourself or a single adjacent target for 5 dice of HP.
  • Gift of Health: Clear most status ailments from yourself or a single target. On yourself, cures sickness, blindness (including from cream pie gunk and the like), hallucination, nausea, confusion, stun, and wounded legs, in addition to the effects of a blessed potion of restore ability.

Their passive powers are as follows:

  • Keen Nose: You gain food appraisal.

Strategy

Buer's Gift of Healing is perhaps best used to keep a character's pets alive, since monster healing is far slower at 1 HP per 20 turns.

As a monster

z Buer (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks bite 8d2 poison (CON), kick 6d4 physical
z Buer (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks

bite 8d2 poison (CON), kick 6d4 physical

Base level 16
Base experience 486
Speed 16
Base AC 4
Base MR 40
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 600
Size large

Buer:

  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is either male or female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

In notdNetHack, Buer, z, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. They are a strong zruty-like animal that is considered both male and female, and can be seen via infravision.

Buer possesses a bite attack that is poisonous and drains constitution, as well as a kick attack.

Like many summoned spirits, Buer cannot be tamed.

Generation

Buer is first generated when summoned from their seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. They are always created hostile, and are not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Buer is generated with the uncursed Talisman of Buer, an artifact amulet of life saving that grants regeneration and sustain ability while worn, and can be invoked to heal the wearer: it restores an amount of HP equal to half the character's maximum while curing sickness, blindness and sliming, much like The Staff of Aesculapius or Release from Care.

Buer does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Outside of their poisonous bite and 16 speed, Buer is fortunately rather unremarkable for a spirit that an Illithanachronounbinder must bind sooner or later, especially permanently unlock martial arts.

If Buer is killed after being summoned, they can be encountered again in the Void, a branch accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Buer is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes them nonliving.

Encyclopedia entry

Who are you, and where are you going?

'''Buer, who walks all places''' is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]].

==Ritual, seal and taboo==
There are no additional restrictions or requirements to bind Buer.

To remain bound to Buer, a character cannot use death magic, such as the [[finger of death]].

==Mark==
The legs of a character that has Buer bound bifurcate into four cloven-hooved feet that can be seen from a distance, but can be hidden by wearing [[boots]].

==Benefits==
While bound, Buer grants extra [[hit point]] [[regeneration]], with the character gaining HP equal to roughly 6 times the character's spirit die size every 90 turns. This is affected by a lit [[dNetHack artifacts#Atma Weapon|Atma Weapon]] as normal. Buer also grants [[skill]] in [[healing spells]] and [[martial arts]], and binding Buer once will permanently teach the character martial arts.

Buer's active powers are as follows:

* '''Gift of Healing''': Heal yourself or a single adjacent target for 5 dice of HP.
* '''Gift of Health''': Clear most status ailments from yourself or a single target. On yourself, cures [[sickness]], [[blindness]] (including from [[cream pie]] gunk and the like), [[hallucination]], [[nausea]], [[confusion]], [[stun]], and [[wounded legs]], in addition to the effects of a blessed [[potion of restore ability]].

Their passive powers are as follows:

* '''Keen Nose''': You gain [[food appraisal]].

==Strategy==
Buer's Gift of Healing is perhaps best used to keep a character's [[pet]]s alive, since monster healing is far slower at 1 HP per 20 turns.

In notdNetHack, '''Buer''', {{yellow|z}}, also appears as a [[monster]] that can be summoned by an [[Illithanachronounbinder]]. They are a [[strong]] [[Zruty (monster class)|zruty-like]] [[animal]] that is considered both male and female, and can be seen via [[infravision]].

Buer possesses a bite attack that is [[poisonous]] and drains [[constitution]], as well as a kick attack.

Like many summoned spirits, Buer cannot be [[tame]]d.

===Generation===
Buer is first generated when summoned from their seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. They are always created hostile, and are not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Buer is [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] the uncursed '''Talisman of Buer''', an artifact [[amulet of life saving]] that grants regeneration and [[sustain ability]] while worn, and can be [[invoked]] to heal the wearer: it restores an amount of HP equal to half the character's maximum while curing sickness, blindness and [[sliming]], much like [[The Staff of Aesculapius]] or [[Release from Care]].

Buer [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.
